Class LevelFour

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.EventHandler.EventNotifier
com.example.demo.Level.LevelParent
com.example.demo.Level.levels.LevelFour
public class LevelFour extends LevelParent
Represents the fourth level of the game. Includes power-up functionality for increasing health and enhancing the user's fire rate.
See Also:
  • LevelParent
  • PowerUp

  • Method Details

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected void checkIfGameOver()
      Checks the game's current state to determine if the game is over. LevelParent.checkIfGameOver() If the user has reached the specified kill target the game stops, and the win condition is activated.
      Specified by:
      checkIfGameOver in class LevelParent

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes the friendly units in the level. This method adds the user's plane, represented by the UserPlane instance returned by the getUser() method, to the root Group of the level. LevelParent.initializeFriendlyUnits() LevelParent.getUser() Overrides the abstract method from the LevelParent class to set up the friendly units specific to this level configuration.
      Specified by:
      initializeFriendlyUnits in class LevelParent

    • userHasReachedKillTarget

      private boolean userHasReachedKillTarget()
      Checks if the user has reached the required number of kills to progress in the level.
      Returns:
      true if the user's number of kills is greater than or equal to the kill target required to advance, false otherwise.

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy units into the game based on the configured total enemy limit and spawn probability. The method calculates how many enemies need to be spawned by subtracting the current number of enemies from the total allowed enemies.
      Specified by:
      spawnEnemyUnits in class LevelParent

    • spawnPowerUp

      private void spawnPowerUp()
      Spawns a power-up at a random horizontal position off-screen, just above the visible game area. This method generates a `HealthPowerUp` or `FireRatePowerUp` object based on a random probability The choice of power-up type is determined using a 50% probability distribution: - `HealthPowerUp`: Increases the player's health when collected. - `FireRatePowerUp`: Temporarily boosts the player's firing rate.

    • updateActors

      protected void updateActors()
      Updates the state and position of active actors within the game, as well as manages interactions with power-ups. Overrides the `updateActors` method from the superclass to add custom behavior for handling power-ups in the game. LevelParent.updateActors() PowerUp.applyEffect(UserPlane) Functionalities performed: - Updates the positions of all active actors as defined in the superclass. - Iterates through the list of active power-ups, updating their positions. - Checks for collisions between the user and power-ups.
      Overrides:
      updateActors in class LevelParent

    • updateScene

      protected void updateScene()
      Updates the scene during each frame of the game loop. This method overrides the `updateScene` functionality in the parent class to add custom behavior specific to the `LevelFour` class. It extends the inherited logic by implementing a mechanic to spawn power-ups at specific frame intervals. LevelParent.updateScene() spawnPowerUp()
      Overrides:
      updateScene in class LevelParent

    • instantiateLevelView

      protected LevelView instantiateLevelView()
      Instantiates and returns a new LevelView object. This method creates a LevelView instance with the specified root Group and initial player health. It overrides the abstract method from the LevelParent class and provides the LevelFour-specific configuration. LevelParent.instantiateLevelView() LevelParent.getRoot()
      Specified by:
      instantiateLevelView in class LevelParent

      Specified by:
